alert.note: Alert for Lower Jefferson; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Lafourche; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. Charles, west central Orleans, northern Lafourche and northwestern Jefferson Parishes through 100 PM CDT... At 1229 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bayou Gauche, or 10 miles south of Hahnville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Avondale, Metairie, Hahnville, Marrero, Harvey, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Luling, River Ridge, Boutte, Ama, Destrehan, St. Rose, Norco, Paradis, Elmwood and Des Allemands. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 216 and 243. Interstate 310 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Lower Jefferson; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Lafourche; Western Orleans
